p:
Extra-hepatic localisation of HEV has been frequently observed. HEV RNA was localised in the immune cells of the lamina propria rather than in enterocytes in the colons of pigs naturally infected with HEV
46 . In rabbit and monkey models, HEV antigens were found in interstitial and infiltrated immune cells
39, 47 . In particular, HEV antigens were detected in lymphoid tissues before they were detected in the liver. Thus, lymphoid tissue is presumed to be a replication site prior to the liver. Negative-strand-specific RT-PCR confirmed the replication of viral RNA in the tonsils and intestines in human HEV-infected pigs before it was detected in the liver
48 , which is in line with the findings in this study.
